alert.note: Alert for Adams; Juneau; Monroe; Richland; Vernon (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 07 at 2:18PM CST until January 10 at 6:00AM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Heavy Snow, Strong Winds Possible Monday Night Into Tuesday Night ... .A winter storm will move through the region Monday night through Tuesday night bringing the potential for heavy snow. While confidence is continuing to increase in significant snowfall amounts, any shift in the forecast track of the system could have implications for snowfall amounts. It will be important to monitor the forecast over the next couple of days as hazardous travel will be likely during this time period. As the storm begins to depart Tuesday and Tuesday night, winds will increase leading to wind gusts of up to 40 mph at times. This may result in blowing and drifting snow, especially in more open areas. ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH LATE TUESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 35 mph leading to blowing and drifting snow. * WHERE...Monroe, Juneau, Adams, Vernon and Richland Counties. * WHEN...From late Monday night through late Tuesday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
